column4: I've had problems with my rt73 raylink wifi device I can't seem to get it to go into master mode also any more.  I guess it's the firmware they now install in the device that's the cause
from that error I'm guessing your wifi driver doesn't support master mode
it works with the same modules as on 11.04 how comes it stopped supporting master mode, what error messages push u to such conclusion?
you should be able to verify manualy if you can put the device in master mode,  I'm just guessing from what I see
I had the same problem with my raylink driver in 2008 it had master mode now today in 2012 it no longer does

the only thing that differs now is that i upgraded to 12.04 from 11.10, it was working flawlessly before, it switches to master mode by hostapd and can't be switched to it manually (at least i don't know the proper way to do that)
so run the old kernel in 12.04 then
if you don't know how to put it in master mode doesn't mean it can't be
if they have any complaints you can PM to continue but then I'll miss helping others here

i was trying to say that after some point, due to changes in some mechanisms, it should be set to master mode like this `iw phy phy0 interface add wlan0 type master` but iw stops saying that i have "... to run a management daemon, e.g. hostapd ..."
you can play with it manualy with  sudo iwconfig;   try man iwconfig to see if you can put it in master mode
iwconfig is no longer designed to switch it to master mode
that means the driver is no longer supporting master mode
no it doesnt mean that, because it was the same way at 11.10
oh I'm not sure then,  maybe hostapd doesn't need master mode?  adhoc might work
I hope you looked at this https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/MasterMode
i'm familiar with described things
and you see "AP" in that list then?
iw shows it supports ap mode obviously
ok sounds like it's not the driver then the new bug must be in hostap,  time to backup to 11.10
or just write your own script to setup an access point, it's not that hard
something like this (but this looks old) you can setup shareing https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Internet/ConnectionSharing
